meanings.definition: Raise (something) to a higher standard, in particular improve (equipment or machinery) by adding or replacing components.
meanings.sent1: She is upgrading her phone to a newer model.
meanings.sent2: The company is upgrading its computers to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The toaster thought it was upgrading to a microwave.
meanings.sent4: The garden gnome felt like upgrading to a statue.
meanings.sent5: The idea of upgrading the car made her smile with excitement.

meanings.definition: Improve (software or hardware) by adding new features or fixing bugs.
meanings.sent1: He is upgrading his computer's operating system for better performance.
meanings.sent2: The company is upgrading its website to enhance user experience.
meanings.sent3: The robot mistakenly tried upgrading its battery with a cookie.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like upgrading to a faster processor.
meanings.sent5: The thought of upgrading the software made him feel like a tech wizard.

meanings.definition: Move to a higher position or rank.
meanings.sent1: She is upgrading to a senior role in the company.
meanings.sent2: The athlete is upgrading to the national team.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried upgrading to the top of the bookshelf but got stuck.
meanings.sent4: His confidence was upgrading to new heights.
meanings.sent5: The promotion felt like upgrading to a whole new level of success.
